contents:
317 About those tins of Christmas Butter Cookies ... posted 2 days ago by rdvs34283 52 comments award share report block Rare, Exquisite, Alabaster @whois_John_Galt • 3d Guys. I have some bad news about the tins of Christmas butter cookies.
52 comments Sort by Top Top New Worst Old Save Around the Web 1 Simple Hack to Cut Your Electric Bill (Try Tonight) GadgetCyno MickHigan2 47 points 2 days ago I find it utterly hilarious that the indians of PDW always get mad at all the disgusting india videos. permalink award report block reply South_Florida_Guy 26 points 2 days ago Just by holding up a mirror to them permalink parent award report block reply magnokor 42 points 2 days ago The local store had some in the catalog, said they were Danish. Saw this, went and had a look, magnified the box picture, Made In China. Just had a look at ALDI, their Danish style Christmas Cookies are made in, maybe a surprise, in Denmark. permalink award report block reply God-is-good 13 points 2 days ago Gotta check every label these days.I ran into one last year that was an unexpected knock off. permalink parent award report block reply 26magarat 5 points 2 days ago Maybe it's like Danish pastries? permalink parent award report block reply Oback_Barama 5 points 2 days ago I’d trust ALDI before Walmart. permalink parent award report block reply Darkpoisonousshaddow 17 points 2 days ago Ooh saar I'm not dirty bastards, I'm just not clean bastards! permalink award report block reply Taliesin 6 points 2 days ago And I do the needful and swat away the rats, saar! permalink parent award report block reply MAGABOND 4 points 2 days ago We are respectable bastards. permalink parent award report block reply HOSEQ 2 points 2 days ago Yusd dond you dell me wad do do, bloody bastard you.... permalink parent award report block reply Trump454748 17 points 2 days ago We have laws in America that prohibit this but we can just import from overseas like that?.🤮 permalink award report block reply Prandogolio 15 points 2 days ago Stop being so fucking gullible.  There's zero evidence that this video has anything to do with those cookies. permalink parent award report block reply N0rds 9 points 2 days ago Yeah the jump cut to the store makes me think it wasn't even what the pajeets were baking permalink parent award report block reply learntocode 4 points 2 days ago They were making indian sweets. The jump cut is deceptive. permalink parent award report block reply Taliesin 4 points 2 days ago The tin says 'made in India.' It does not necessarily mean that these were the particular brand of cookies being made, but between street-shitting, asswiping with bare hands, and swatting rats off food being prepared, India definitely has a hygiene problem. permalink parent award report block reply Hantif 10 points 2 days ago Always check country of origin. Never buy food from India, China, or anywhere else you wouldn't eat from a street vendor. permalink award report block reply DrVSGGEOTUSPhD 7 points 2 days ago This song GOES HARD permalink award report block reply Taliesin 1 points 2 days ago Yes, indeed saar! permalink parent award report block reply Quidnunc 7 points 2 days ago Bake your own cookies. Unless you really like the taste of partially hydrogenated soy and all the alphabet chemicals to keep it from molding for a year or more. permalink award report block reply gillonba 1 points 2 days ago This is the correct answer.  Cookies made in the US and Europe are still trash, just a different sort of trash.  Any (unsealed) baked good that can sit on a shelf for weeks or even months without going bad should probably not be eaten permalink parent award report block reply Oldman1234 6 points 2 days ago Oh no!  I just bought one of those tins!  Is this real? permalink award report block reply Darkpoisonousshaddow 23 points 2 days ago Stay away from the chocolate chips permalink parent award report block reply Oldman1234 8 points 2 days ago Excellent advice. Thanks! permalink parent award report block reply Prandogolio 6 points 2 days ago Well there's absolutely no evidence presented in this video that it has anything to do with those cookies. Why don't you practice being a mega ultra genius super detective and look on the side of the cookie tin you just bought and read where they were made? permalink parent award report block reply Oldman1234 5 points 2 days ago The issue for me isn't really WHERE they're made but HOW they're made (as shown in the video). permalink parent award report block reply Litecola2 6 points 2 days ago If you are buying foods made in India you get what you deserve permalink parent award report block reply Prandogolio -1 points 2 days ago But what makes you think they're being made the way they're making them in the video?  They're made in a factory.  Calm down you gullible doofus. permalink parent award report block reply Littleirishmaid 5 points 2 days ago I could not read the back.  Where does it say they were made? permalink parent award report block reply Darkpoisonousshaddow 8 points 2 days ago India permalink parent award report block reply ChyNahAzzWhole1 6 points 2 days ago Watching on my phone I can magnify the screenshot. In d ia permalink parent award report block reply corntortilla 1 points 2 days ago Of course not. permalink parent award report block reply Kendoextendo 5 points 2 days ago All I ever find in those tins is sewing supplies. Now I'm thinking granny was just looking out for me. permalink award report block reply PepesJusticeBoner 4 points 2 days ago We have a local grandmother who bakes delicious cookies. The money she makes helps her keep up with inflation despite being on a fixed income. Hopefully every pede can find a local grandmother or struggling mom and buy cookies from them instead of disgusting store bought imported garbage cookies. permalink award report block reply Valiazaner 3 points 2 days ago Just make your own. It is dead simple and tastes better. permalink award report block reply Darkpoisonousshaddow 2 points 2 days ago Flour, butter and sugar. permalink parent award report block reply BannedAccount 3 points 2 days ago I dont even eat those gross ass cookies thankfully permalink award report block reply WeaponizedSmirk 2 points 2 days ago The ones I get are locally made. permalink award report block reply Smurfection 2 points 2 days ago This has the makings of those "chicken nuggets are made from pink slime" vids of the aughts.   Pink slime wasn't a thing in the U.S except in animal feed.  That being said Caveat Emptor, buyer beware. permalink award report block reply HOSEQ 1 points 2 days ago Carpe Carpets.... permalink parent award report block reply CharlesWilliams 2 points 2 days ago Holy crap, was eating these exact cookies while viewing this, now I can’t stop retching…. I may never eat anything I didn’t cook myself again. permalink award report block reply Keep_on_winning_kag 1 points 2 days ago Just eat the cookies you'll be fine. permalink parent award report block reply CharlesWilliams 1 points 18 hours ago No, I’m dead.  Now I’m haunting you for mocking my demise.  LOL. permalink parent award report block reply Froynlavenfroynlaven 2 points 2 days ago This would be more credible if the video showed any evidence of the molds for the different shapes they come in. permalink award report block reply rauschman 2 points 2 days ago I have a similar tin I've bought in the past in Bavaria. Its produced in Denmark, thank God. I watched this and immediately went and looked, lol. permalink award report block reply patrioticwinning3 1 points 2 days ago The first Time I have seen, "Made in India" on those.... permalink award report block reply Choppermagic 1 points 2 days ago I don't understand.  Why is there video of grandma's sewing supply tins at the end? permalink award report block reply Wildwind 1 points 2 days ago Its a damn funny fake video. permalink award report block reply truthjusticetruth 1 points 2 days ago This is fake. Multiple separate videos spliced together. FAKE NEWS. permalink award report block reply learntocode 1 points 2 days ago I still LOL all the same permalink parent award report block reply Keep_on_winning_kag 1 points 2 days ago Aldi sells a lot of shit thats made in india. Don't buy products made in india, simple as that. permalink award report block reply RyanKeyOh 1 points 2 days ago Fake permalink award report block reply greatpumpkin 1 points 2 days ago I need a shower just watching that. permalink award report block reply learntocode 1 points 2 days ago These cookies are ridiculously easy to make yourself. Shortbread - butter and flour. Boom done. WTF was I raised on magic tins of this shit? Because mom AND dad had to work full time. Sick of this shit. permalink award report block reply JanxyJet 0 points 2 days ago Fake, for those cookies. But  many are from China, now. They're smart enough to not allow outside cameras, donchaknow. Watch your labels! permalink award report block reply
